archimate:BusinessEvent.name: Management believe we have architects because many have the title
archimate:BusinessEvent.documentation:
On paper we often look good. The organization appears to have many architects, so the actual issues are not addressed. Any resource can be an architect, because in the job catalogue the architect position is defined in such a high level that the technical aspects of creating systems can be implemented without any of the design disciplines.
Because thereâ€™s no architecture practice there are no skilling minimums, and the title of architect is effectively meaningless, leading to very different levels of skills in different places. The resources that are in place do have a set of skills we need for building systems, but they lack a whole set of core skills, and we have no way of seeing that.
